title: Invalid Mocks in @Nested Tests with @TestProfile after upgrade to Quarkus 3
body:
### Describe the bug

Hello,

We recently migrated to Quarkus 3 (latest version, which is 3.0.3.Final). Some of the test which were previously working are not working anymore. Basically, mocks injected with `@InjectMocks` are not recognized as mocks in the `@Nested` classes which also have a custom test profile:


```
@QuarkusTest
public class GreetingResourceTest {

    @InjectMock
    @RestClient
    RestService restService;

    @BeforeEach
    public void init() {
        doReturn(new CompletableFuture<String>()
            .completeAsync(() ->
                ""))
            .when(restService).doService();
    }

    @Nested
    @TestProfile(GreetingResourceTest.Profile.class)
    public class NestedTest {
        @Test
        public void testNested() {
            doReturn(new CompletableFuture<String>()
                .completeAsync(() ->
                    "a"))
                .when(restService).doService();
            given()
                .when()
                .get("/v1/greet")
                .then()
                .statusCode(200);
        }
    }

    public static class Profile implements QuarkusTestProfile {

    }
}
```

The RestService is just a basic RestClient:

```
@RegisterRestClient(baseUri = "https://example.com")
@Consumes({MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON})
@Produces({MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON})
@Path("/")
public interface RestService {
    @POST
    @Path("/service")
    CompletionStage<String> doService();
}
```

The error which I am getting is the following: 
```
org.mockito.exceptions.misusing.NotAMockException: 
Argument passed to when() is not a mock!
Example of correct stubbing:
    doThrow(new RuntimeException()).when(mock).someMethod();
```
